inclusion.criterion: prostate cancer with high risk features defined as Gleason 8 and higher OR PSA > 20 ng/mL OR clinical stage T3a (i.e. likely extraprostatic extension on MRI) or T3b
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: eligible for and planning to undergo radical prostatectomy and lymphadenectomy regardless of findings on 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: age greater than or equal to 18 years
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: adequate organ and marrow function as defined below: Hemoglobin greater than or equal to 9 g/dL, leukocytes greater than or equal to 3,000/mcL, platelets greater than or equal to 100,000/mcL, total bilirubin <2 X normal institutional limits, AST(SGOT)/ALT(SGPT) less than or equal to 3 X normal institutional limits, creatinine <2 X normal institutional limits, eGFR greater than or equal to 50 mL/min/1.73 m2 for patients with creatinine levels above institutional normal
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: ability of subject to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent document
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willingness and ability to undergo biopsy of radiotracer-avid lesion if feasible
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: willingness and ability to undergo multiparametric prostate MRI and 18F-DCFPyL PET/CT
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: any investigational agents in the past 28 days prior to enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: clinical stage T4 (tumor invades adjacent structures except seminal vesicles)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: distant metastatic disease on conventional imaging studies (computed tomography of the abdomen and pelvis and 99mTc-methylene diphosphonate bone scan (bone scan))
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: any prior hormone therapy used to treat prostate cancer, except limited androgen receptor antagonist therapy, defined as less than or equal to 3 days of treatment. The medication must be discontinued within 5 half-lives of the compound prior to study entry
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: any prior therapy for prostate cancer with surgery, radiation, and/or chemotherapy
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient is a 63-year-old man presenting to the Emergency Department with a history of acute urinary retention in the past 2 days. Abdominopelvic CT scan revealed a large prostate and a bladder filled with urine.
